Pianoroll (libsoni.core.pianoroll)ÔÉÅ

libsoni.core.pianoroll.sonify_pianoroll_additive_synthesis(pianoroll_df: DataFrame, partials: ndarray = array([1]), partials_amplitudes: ndarray | None = None, partials_phase_offsets: ndarray | None = None, tuning_frequency: float = 440.0, sonification_duration: int | None = None, normalize: bool = True, fs: int = 22050) → ndarray[source]ÔÉÅ

This function sonifies a pianoroll representation containing pitch events described by start, duration or end and the corresponding pitch with additive synthesis.

Parameters:

  • pianoroll_df (pd.DataFrame) ‚Äì Dataframe

  • partials (np.ndarray, default = [1]) ‚Äì

    An array containing the desired partials of the fundamental frequencies for sonification.

    An array [1] leads to sonification with only the fundamental frequency core, while an array [1,2] causes sonification with the fundamental frequency and twice the fundamental frequency.

  • partials_amplitudes (np.ndarray, default = [1]) ‚Äì

    Array containing the amplitudes for partials.

    An array [1,0.5] causes the sinusoid with frequency core to have amplitude 1, while the sinusoid with frequency 2*core has amplitude 0.5.

  • partials_phase_offsets (np.ndarray, default = [0]) ‚Äì Array containing the phase offsets for partials.

  • tuning_frequency (float, default = 440.0) ‚Äì Tuning frequency in Her

  • sonification_duration (int, default = None) ‚Äì Duration of the output waveform, given in samples.

  • normalize (bool, default = True) ‚Äì Decides, if output signal is normalized to [-1,1].

  • fs (int, default = 22050) ‚Äì Sampling rate

Returns:

pianoroll_sonification ‚Äì Sonified waveform in form of a 1D Numpy array

Return type:

np.ndarray

libsoni.core.pianoroll.sonify_pianoroll_clicks(pianoroll_df: DataFrame, tuning_frequency: float = 440.0, sonification_duration: int | None = None, normalize: bool = True, fs: int = 22050) → ndarray[source]ÔÉÅ

This function sonifies a pianoroll representation containing pitch events described by start, duration or end and the corresponding pitch with coloured clicks.

Parameters:

  • pianoroll_df (pd.DataFrame) ‚Äì Data Frame containing pitch events.

  • tuning_frequency (float, default = 440.0) ‚Äì Tuning Frequency, given in Hertz

  • sonification_duration (int, default = None) ‚Äì Duration of the output waveform, given in samples.

  • normalize (bool, default = True) ‚Äì Decides, if output signal is normalized to [-1,1].

  • fs (int, default = 22050) ‚Äì Sampling rate

Returns:

pianoroll_sonification ‚Äì Sonified waveform in form of a 1D Numpy array.

Return type:

np.ndarray

libsoni.core.pianoroll.sonify_pianoroll_etc()[source]ÔÉÅ
libsoni.core.pianoroll.sonify_pianoroll_fm_synthesis(pianoroll_df: DataFrame, mod_rate_relative: float = 0.0, mod_amp: float = 0.0, tuning_frequency: float = 440.0, sonification_duration: int | None = None, normalize: bool = True, fs: int = 22050) → ndarray[source]ÔÉÅ

This function sonifies a pianoroll representation containing pitch events described by start, duration or end and the corresponding pitch with frequency major synthesis.

Parameters:

  • pianoroll_df (pd.DataFrame) ‚Äì Dataframe

  • mod_rate_relative (float, default = 0.0) ‚Äì Determines the modulation frequency as multiple or fraction of the frequency for the given pitch.

  • mod_amp (float, default = 0.0) ‚Äì Determines the amount of modulation in the generated signal.

  • tuning_frequency (float, default = 440.0) ‚Äì Tuning frequency in Her

  • sonification_duration (int, default = None) ‚Äì Duration of the output waveform, given in samples.

  • normalize (bool, default = True) ‚Äì Decides, if output signal is normalized to [-1,1].

  • fs (int, default = 22050) ‚Äì Sampling rate

Returns:

pianoroll_sonification ‚Äì Sonified waveform in form of a 1D Numpy array.

Return type:

np.ndarray

libsoni.core.pianoroll.sonify_pianoroll_sample(pianoroll_df: DataFrame, sample: ndarray | None = None, reference_pitch: int = 69, sonification_duration: int | None = None, normalize: bool = True, fs: int = 22050) → ndarray[source]ÔÉÅ
This function sonifies a pianoroll representation containing pitch events described by start, sonification_duration or end

and the corresponding pitch with pitch-shifted and time-warped versions of a sample.

Parameters:

  • pianoroll_df (pd.DataFrame) ‚Äì Data Frame containing pitch events.

  • sample (np.ndarray) ‚Äì Sample

  • reference_pitch (int, default = 69) ‚Äì Pitch of the Sample

  • sonification_duration (int, default = None) ‚Äì Duration of the output waveform, given in samples.

  • normalize (bool, default = True) ‚Äì Decides, if output signal is normalized to [-1,1].

  • fs (int, default = 22050) ‚Äì Sampling rate

Returns:

pianoroll_sonification ‚Äì Sonified waveform in form of a 1D Numpy array.

Return type:

np.ndarray

libsoni.core.pianoroll.visualize_pianoroll(df, xlabel='Time (seconds)', ylabel='Pitch', title: str | None = None, colors='FMP_1', velocity_alpha=False, figsize=(12, 4), ax=None, dpi=72)[source]ÔÉÅ

Plot a pianoroll visualization, inspired from FMP Notebook C1/C1S2_CSV.ipynb

Parameters:

  • score ‚Äì List of note events

  • xlabel ‚Äì Label for x axis (Default value = ‚ÄòTime (seconds)‚Äô)

  • ylabel ‚Äì Label for y axis (Default value = ‚ÄòPitch‚Äô)

  • colors ‚Äì Several options: 1. string of FMP_COLORMAPS, 2. string of matplotlib colormap, 3. list or np.ndarray of matplotlib color specifications, 4. dict that assigns labels to colors (Default value = ‚ÄòFMP_1‚Äô)

  • velocity_alpha ‚Äì Use the velocity value for the alpha value of the corresponding rectangle (Default value = False)

  • figsize ‚Äì Width, height in inches (Default value = (12)

  • ax ‚Äì The Axes instance to plot on (Default value = None)

  • dpi ‚Äì Dots per inch (Default value = 72)

Returns:

The created matplotlib figure or None if ax was given. ax: The used axes

Return type:

fig
